clinical_study.official_title: Effects of 12 Weeks of Beach Tennis Training on Blood Pressure in Hypertensive Individuals: a Randomized Clinical Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Hospital de Clinicas de Porto Alegre

collaborator.agency: Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul

clinical_study.source: Hospital de Clinicas de Porto Alegre

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a randomized controlled trial, in parallel, aimed to evaluate the effects of 12 weeks of Beach Tennis Training on blood pressure in hypertensive participants. The current hypothesis is that 12 weeks of Beach Tennis Training will reduce blood pressure, when compared to pre training corresponding values and to the control group without exercise.

detailed_description.textblock:
Although exercise is widely recommended as a non-pharmacological therapy to reduce blood pressure (BP), the efficacy of sport training in reduce BP is poorly investigated. The potential anti-hypertensive effects of Beach Tennis (BT) training in reduce BP remain unclear, particularly in individuals with hypertension.
This is a randomized parallel trial to evaluate the effects of 12 weeks of Beach Tennis training on ambulatory blood pressure in hypertensive participants. The current hypothesis is that Beach Tennis Training will reduce blood pressure, when compared to pre training corresponding values and to the control group without exercise.
Men and women aged between 35 and 65 years with the medical diagnosis of hypertension will composed the sample of this study. The primary outcome variable (i.e., 24h, daytime and nighttime systolic and diastolic blood pressure) will be assessed before and after the 12 weeks of interventions through outpatient blood pressure monitoring.
The participants will be randomized in two different groups: BT training group, which will perform two sessions per week of BT training and a control intervention (control group), which will perform one session per week of theoretical-practical lectures of BT and health education.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline 24-hour systolic blood pressure at 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: 24h ambulatory blood pressure measured through automatic oscillometric device

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline office blood pressure at 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Systolic blood pressure in mmHg measured using automatic oscillometric device

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline office blood pressure at 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Diastolic blood pressure in mmHg measured using automatic oscillometric device

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline VO2peak at 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Oxygen consumption at peak (VO2peak) as assessed by maximal cardiopulmonary exercise testing

secondary_outcome.measure: Muscle strength (Test of hand grip strength)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline handgrip at 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Performs palmar grip with the greatest possible force

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline vertical countermovement jump at 12 weeks
Change from baseline QoL score at 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: The questionnaire contains 26 questions and is divided into four domains (physical, psychological, social and environmental). Responses follow a Likert scale (1 to 5, the higher the score the better the quality of life) and the values of each domain will be expressed in percentage values.

arm_group.description: Control group will perform one session per week, composed of theoretical-practical classes on fundamentals of BT and lectures on health education.
The Beach Tennis (BT) group will perform two sessions per week of the Beach Tennis training. This intervention will last 12 weeks.

intervention.description: Beach Tennis Training Group (BTG) will perform two sessions of 40-60 min of beach tennis during 12 weeks. BT sessions will be composed by a warm up of 5-10 min of BT technical exercises (i.e., serve, volley, forehand and backhand exercises) followed by 3 BT small games of 10-15 min each.

Control group (CG) will attend BT lectures (10 min) and technical exercises (i.e., serve, volley, forehand and backhand exercises) throughout 10 min plus lectures on health education during 20 min, lasting 40 min in total. This session will be performed once a week throughout 12 weeks.
